db:info.db:title: Custom3DItem QML Type
db:info.db:edition: Qt Data Visualization | Commercial or GPLv3

db:abstract.db:para: Adds a custom item to a graph.
This type was introduced in QtDataVisualization 1.1.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: A custom item has a custom mesh, position, scaling, rotation, and an optional texture.

db:section.db:title: meshFile : string
db:section.db:para: The item mesh file name. The item in the file must be in Wavefront OBJ format and include vertices, normals, and UVs. It also needs to be in triangles.

db:section.db:title: position : vector3d
db:section.db:para: The item position as a vector3d type. Defaults to vector3d(0.0, 0.0, 0.0).

Item position is specified either in data coordinates or in absolute coordinates, depending on the value of the positionAbsolute property. When using absolute coordinates, values between -1.0...1.0 are within axis ranges.

db:note.db:para: Items positioned outside any axis range are not rendered if positionAbsolute is false, unless the item is a Custom3DVolume that would be partially visible and scalingAbsolute is also false. In that case, the visible portion of the volume will be rendered.

db:section.db:title: positionAbsolute : bool
db:section.db:para: Defines whether item position is to be handled in data coordinates or in absolute coordinates. Defaults to false. Items with absolute coordinates will always be rendered, whereas items with data coordinates are only rendered if they are within axis ranges.

db:section.db:title: rotation : quaternion
db:section.db:para: The item rotation as a quaternion. Defaults to quaternion(0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0).

db:section.db:title: scaling : vector3d
db:section.db:para: The item scaling as a vector3d type. Defaults to vector3d(0.1, 0.1, 0.1).

Item scaling is specified either in data values or in absolute values, depending on the value of the scalingAbsolute property. The default vector interpreted as absolute values sets the item to 10% of the height of the graph, provided the item mesh is normalized and the graph aspect ratios have not been changed from the defaults.

db:section.db:title: [since QtDataVisualization 1.2] scalingAbsolute : bool
db:section.db:para: Defines whether item scaling is to be handled in data values or in absolute values. Defaults to true. Items with absolute scaling will be rendered at the same size, regardless of axis ranges. Items with data scaling will change their apparent size according to the axis ranges. If positionAbsolute is true, this property is ignored and scaling is interpreted as an absolute value. If the item has rotation, the data scaling is calculated on the unrotated item. Similarly, for Custom3DVolume items, the range clipping is calculated on the unrotated item.

db:note.db:para: Only absolute scaling is supported for Custom3DLabel items or for custom items used in polar graphs.
The custom item's mesh must be normalized to the range [-1 ,1], or the data scaling will not be accurate.

db:section.db:para: This property was introduced in QtDataVisualization 1.2.

db:section.db:title: shadowCasting : bool
db:section.db:para: Defines whether shadow casting for the item is enabled. Defaults to true. If false, the item does not cast shadows regardless of ShadowQuality.

db:section.db:title: textureFile : string
db:section.db:para: The texture file name for the item. If left unset, a solid gray texture will be used.

db:note.db:para: To conserve memory, the QImage loaded from the file is cleared after a texture is created.

db:section.db:title: visible : bool
db:section.db:para: The visibility of the item. Defaults to true.

db:section.db:title: void setRotationAxisAndAngle(vector3d axis, real angle)
db:section.db:para: A convenience function to construct the rotation quaternion from axis and angle.
